sen.j: 飛来 一閑（ひき いっかん）は千家十職の一つ、一閑張細工師の当主が代々襲名している名称。
sen.e: Ikkan HIKI is one of the Senke jusshoku (Senke's ten designated craftsmen families) and the name is succeeded by the head of Ikkanbari saikushi (artisan of lacquered papier-mache) from generation to generation.

sen.j: 漆工芸の一種・一閑張の日本における創始者であり、また歴代千家に一閑張による棗や香合などの道具を納めてきた細工師の家系である。
sen.e: Ikkan HIKI is the family of an artisan who started one of the lacquer craftworks, Ikkanbari (workmanship which is made of bamboo basket covered with Japanese paper painted persimmon juice) in Japan and also have delivered tea utensils such as Ikkanbari natsume (a container for powdered tea) and kogo (an incense container) to successive Senke families.

sen.j: 当代は16代にあたり、12代・中村宗哲と並ぶ千家十職としては珍しい女性当主である。
sen.e: The family is now in the 16th generation, and a present head of the family is a woman, unusual for the Senke jusshoku and next to the 12th Sotetsu NAKAMURA.

sen.j: 飛来家は亡命明人の末裔である。
sen.e: HIKI family is a descendant of an exile from the Ming.

sen.j: 初代一閑は現在の浙江省杭州市の出身であったが、清の侵攻が中国南部まで及び、身の危険を感じて大徳寺の清巌宗渭和尚を頼り、寛永頃に日本へ亡命した。
sen.e: The first Ikkan HIKI was from present-day Hangzhou City, Zhejiang Province, but Ching's invasion extended to the southern China, so he worried about his safety and exiled himself to Japan couting on Soi SEIGAN Osho (priest Seigan) of Daitoku-ji Temple in around the Kanei era.

sen.j: 日本ではこの清巌和尚の手引きにより千宗旦に紹介され、趣味であった一閑張の細工による小物の注文を受けるようになった。
sen.e: In Japan, he was introduced to Sotan SEN with the SEIGAN Osho's help and started to receive an order for small articles crafted with Ikkanbari, which was one of his hobbies.

sen.j: その後家業を再開したのが3代一閑であり、4代一閑は表千家6代・覚々斎の御用細工師となる。
sen.e: It was the 3rd Ikkan who started the family business again and the 4th Ikkan became the craftsman patronized by Kakukakusai, the sixth grand master of Omote Sen-ke.

sen.j: しかし、6代から8代までは早世する当主が相次ぎ、家業の維持すら困難な状態となる。
sen.e: However, all heads of the family from the 6th to 8th died early one after the other and they were in trouble even to maintain their family business.

sen.j: 9代一閑は家業の再興に尽力するも、最晩年に大火に遭遇し失意の内に没した。
sen.e: The 9th Ikkan worked hard for reviving their family business but had a great fire in his later years and died in hopelessness.

sen.e: The 10th Ikkan tried to restore their family with the style that followed the 1st Ikkan's style.

sen.e: The 11th Ikkan took over the 10th Ikkan's intention and achieved mastery of the craft and his skills was called "master" and said to be a reviver.

sen.j: 14代一閑は後継者となるべく育てた2人の息子を太平洋戦争の徴兵による戦死で失う。
sen.e: The 14th Ikkan's two sons whom he brought up to be his successors were drafted and killed in the Pacific War.

sen.e: The 15th Ikkan, an adopted son-in-law, died before he achieved great success as a craftsman.
